definition: year in, year out (idiom)/(over) many years
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: The ancient tower still stops up,exposed to the weather for ages.
sentences.chinese: 經過長年累月的風吹日曬，那座古塔依然豎立在那裏。

sentences.english: Clouds of smoke and steam filled the air for ever and ever .
sentences.chinese: 空氣里長年累月充滿着繚繞不絕的濃煙和蒸氣。

sentences.english: The cataract is flattening the huge stone all the year round.
sentences.chinese: 翻譯大瀑布長年累月地衝刷着巨石。

sentences.english: Year in year out he has been doing fieldwork in the Northwest.
sentences.chinese: 他長年累月在大西北從事野外工作。

sentences.english: The profound erudition of the writer came from long years of study.
sentences.chinese: 這位作家淵博的學問來自長年累月的鑽研。
